html: (7) I will mention . . .—The words begin an entirely new section, of the nature of a psalm of thanksgiving for redemption ( Isaiah 63:16). Possibly, in the arrangement of the book it was thought that such a psalm followed rightly on the great dramatic dialogue which represented the victory of the Redeemer. The psalm begins, according to the implied rule of Psalms 50:23 , with praise, and passes afterward to narrative and supplication.
